about.title: FAR OUT FLATBEDS
about.subtitle: Born From Experience
about.description: I’ve been into trucks and off-roading pretty much my whole life. For the last five years I’ve worked in the off-road industry, which gave me a front row seat to how this space has grown and where it’s heading. The biggest thing I have taken away is the idea that we can build cool, well-thought-out stuff right here in the U.S., and do it in a way that actually makes sense for the people using it. Flatbeds have always caught my eye, but most felt overbuilt, limited, or not flexible enough. I wanted something modular that could change with your setup instead of locking you into one.
about.description_additional_one: That idea became Far Out Flatbeds. Using extruded aluminum as the backbone, we built a platform that’s strong, lightweight, and endlessly adaptable — a bed that fits you, your truck, and your lifestyle.
about.description_additional_two: Far Out Flatbeds is about more than building beds. It’s about rethinking what a flatbed can be — designed by enthusiasts, for enthusiasts, with innovation, practicality, and style at its core.
about.narrative_body:
The thing that sets this bed apart from anything else on the market is its ability to flatpack ship straight to your door, paired with the modularity of an extruded aluminum deck. That means you can bolt on just about any accessory you can think of, and you're not locked into a single setup.

It's a flatbed built to change and adapt to whatever job or activity you're into. On top of that, it's designed to be universal. If you ever upgrade trucks — as long as it's a similar size and bed length, you can bring your flatbed with you.

Instead of starting over every time you change rigs, your setup stays with you.

1.title: Bolt-Together Design
1.description: Anodized aluminum extrusions connect with serviceable hardware allowing for endless repairs and upgrades.

2.title: Flatpac Shipping
2.description: Our bolt-together design ships flat to your door and assembles fast for a modular upgrade.

3.title: Powder-Coated Armor
3.description: Textured powder coat shrugs off trail rash while sealed seams keep corrosion at bay.

4.title: Oversized Fenders
4.description: Designed to swallow 40-inch tires with room to spare, keeping clearance dialed on any trail.

5.title: Modular Gear Rails
5.description: Full-perimeter accessory rail accepts MOLLE plates, RTT mounts, and cargo solutions without drilling.

6.title: Storage Options
6.description: Integrated drawers, cubbies, and tie-down points keep tools and gear organized for any mission.

7.title: Transferable Between Vehicles
7.description: Swap the flatbed onto any similar-size truck when you upgrade, so your setup keeps rolling with you.

landing_product.title: Ready to build yours?
landing_product.body: Lock in the first production run of the Far Out Flatbed. We’ll confirm fitment details after checkout and keep you updated as your build progresses.
